content:
To make a scene of someone disappearing into a computer more Black Mirror-ish, you can add some dark and unsettling elements to the visual effects and storytelling. Here are a few suggestions:

1. Use a glitchy and distorted visual effect on the computer interface to make it look like a malfunctioning technology that's pulling the person in. You can also add flickering lights, static noise, or distorted sound effects to add to the unease.
2. Add some eerie music or sound effects to the scene to create a sense of foreboding. You can use a haunting melody, discordant sounds, or even white noise to create an unsettling atmosphere.
3. Make the disappearance itself more intense and disturbing. For example, you can add some flashes of light or disorienting camera movements to make it look like the person is being sucked into the computer. You can also use quick cuts to create a jarring effect that leaves the viewer feeling unsettled.
4. Consider adding a twist to the scene that reveals a darker side to the technology. For example, you can show that the person who disappears into the computer is actually being trapped in a digital realm or that the computer itself is alive and malevolent.

By adding these elements, you can make the scene more Black Mirror-ish and create a sense of unease and tension that will leave the viewer on the edge of their seat.
